questions.text: Which of these teams has Randy Johnson not pitched for?
questions.explanation:
San Diego Padres.

	Randy Johnson's nickname is the Big Unit and he won a World Series with the 2001 Arizona Diamondbacks.  Randy retired in 2009 with 303 wins.

Willie Mays.

	Willie Mays also played for the Giants and made one of the greatest over-the-shoulder catches ever.  Willie hit 660 home runs.

questions.text: How many home runs did Barry Bonds hit in the 2001 season, and broke Mark McGwire's season record?
questions.explanation:
73.

	Barry Bonds originally played for the Pittsburgh Pirates.  With the Giants, he broke McGwire's season record with McGwire set with the Cardinals in 1998.

questions.text: Whose number is retired throughout all of baseball?
questions.explanation:
Jackie Robinson.

	Jackie Robinson broke the color barrier in the Major Leagues in 1947, and also played in the Negro Leagues for the Kansas City Monarchs.

questions.text: What long-time owner of the Yankees died in 2010?
questions.explanation:
George Steinbrenner.

	George Steinbrenner bought the Yankees from CBS in 1973.

questions.text: Who hit the game winning home run in game five of the 2010 World Series?
questions.explanation:
Edgar Renteria.

	Edgar Renteria also hit the game winning hit in the 1997 World Series for the Florida Marlins.  In 2010, he won the World Series MVP with the Giants.

questions.text: Who won the 2010 Home Run Derby?
questions.explanation:
David Ortiz.

	David Ortiz won two World Series in 2004 and 2008 with the Boston Red Sox and has a book about his life.

questions.text: Who won the 2009 AL Cy Young Award?
questions.explanation:
Zack Greinke.

	Zack Greinke was a KC Royals pitcher.  He was the third Royal pitcher to win the Cy Young, after David Cone in 1994 and Bret Saberhagen in 1985 and 1989.

questions.text: Which of these pitchers was undefeated in the postseason until the 2010 World Series where he lost twice?
questions.explanation:
Cliff Lee.

	Cliff Lee appeared in the 2009 and 2010 World Series with the Phillies and Rangers, then in December 2010, signed back with the Phillies as a free agent.

questions.text: Who was the rookie catcher for the 2010 World Series winning Giants?
questions.explanation:
Buster Posey.

	Buster Posey won the 2010 NL Rookie of the Year with the Giants, and went to Florida State for college.  The Giants traded Bengie Molina to make room for Posey.
